Source code for hamcalc.math.decifrac

"""hamcalc.math.decifrac -- Decimals to fractions

Some Test Cases

>>> import  hamcalc.math.decifrac as decifrac
>>> decifrac.FEET_INCH_FRAC_TUPLE.to_std( 13, 3, 5, 8 )
>>> 13.302

"""

from hamcalc.lib import Unit, Standard_Unit
import re

introduction = """\
DECIMAL / FRACTION CONVERTER                                by George C. Murphy
"""

def intro():
    return introduction


[docs]class INCHES( Standard_Unit ):
    """Decimal Inches"""
    name= "in"



[docs]class FEET( Unit ):
    """Decimal Feet"""
    name= "ft"
    standard= INCHES
    factor= 1/12



[docs]class FEET_INCH_FRAC_TUPLE( Unit ):
    """Feet-Inch-Fraction"""
    name='ft-in'
    standard= INCHES
    @classmethod
    def _gcd( a, b ):
        if a == 0: return b
        elif b == 0: return a
        elif a < b:
            return gcd( b-a, a )
        else:
            return gcd( a-b, b )
    @classmethod
    def to_std( class_, value ):
        f, i, n, d = value
        return f*12+i+n/d
    @classmethod
    def from_std( class_, value ):
        n = int(value*128) % 128
        i = int(value) % 12
        f = int(value//12)
        # Reduce the n/128, if possible.
        r = class_._gcd( n, 128 )
        n= n // r
        d= 128 // r
        return f, i, n, d



[docs]class MILLIMETRES( Unit ):
    """Decimal Millimetres"""
    name= "in"
    standard= FEET
    factor= 25.4



[docs]class CENTIMETRES( Unit ):
    """Decimal Centimetres"""
    name= "in"
    standard= FEET
    factor= 2.54



[docs]class METRES( Unit ):
    """Decimal Metres"""
    name= "in"
    standard= FEET
    factor= .0254
